quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Group
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, bette, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Band member Geddy Lee has referred to this 1981 track as the quintessential Rush song.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tom Sawyer

questions.question: Which of the following songwriting teams are credited with 1973 song Daniel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John-Taupin

questions.question: This one hit wonder topped the Billboard charts in 1972 with the song Brandy (Youre a Fine Girl).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Looking Glass

questions.question: Rhiannon was a hit song for this group in 1976.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fleetwood Mac

questions.question: Which of the following jazz artists has his/her name in the title of this 1976 #1 hit for Stevie Wonder?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Duke Ellington

questions.question: Joanna was a successful single for this New Jersey group in 1983.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kool  the Gang

questions.question: Bette Davis Eyes was originally recorded in 1974 by Jackie DeShannon, but this female vocalist brought the song to number one for nine consecutive weeks in 1981.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kim Carnes

questions.question: This song, featuring a prominent mandolin, was a #1 hit for Rod Stewart in 1971.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maggie May

questions.question: My Maria was originally a top ten hit for this artist in 1973 before it went to #1 in 1996 for country artists Brooks  Dunn.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: B. W. Stephenson

questions.question: The song Cecilia is a song by Simon and Garfunkel from this 1970 album.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bridge Over Troubled Water

questions.question: This group released the song Amie from their 1972 album Bustin Out.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pure Prairie League

questions.question: Peg and Josie are both tracks from the 1977 album, Aja, by this rock group.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steely Dan

questions.question: According to the title and lyrics of this 1982 Tommy Tutone hit, whose phone number is 867-5309?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jenny

questions.question: Which band recorded the soft rock song Aubrey in 1973?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bread

questions.question: Which artist released the top ten hit Valerie in 1982?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steve Winwood

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lola

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Appetite for Destruction

questions.question: The song Ms. Jackson was a successful track from the  album Stankonia, which has been certified quadruple platinum.  Which hip hop group released this profitable record in 2000?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chicago

questions.question: Amanda was a hit from the album, Third Stage, in 1986 for this band which hadnt released an album in eight years.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Boston

questions.question: Peter Piper is a track on this 1986 album by Run DMC.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Raising Hell

questions.question: The poignant Grammy winning single Jeremy is a track from the 1991 album, Ten, by this Seattle band.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pearl Jam

questions.question: For the price of a dime, who would answer when Tommy Tutone dialed 867-5309?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jenny

questions.question: Bali Hai is the forbidden mystical island in which musical of the 50’s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: South Pacific

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Lady and Song
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, vocalist, rawness. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This 1980s band, popular for the song Girls, Girls, Girls, was made up of members Tommy Lee, Vince Neil, Mick Mars, and Nikki Sixx.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Motley Crue

questions.question: Which of the following bands are known for the songs Slide It In,  Slow and Easy, and Love Aint No Stranger?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Whitesnake

questions.question: Charles Manson and his followers were convicted of the Sharon Tate murders and the following night murders of Rosemary and Leo LaBianca. Charles Manson thought the Beatles were singing to him in the White album about the worlds destruction. From what Beatles song did Manson choose a nickname for convicted murderer Susan Atkins?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sexy Sadie

questions.question: Wilson Pickett bought his lady a new car but now all she wants to do is ride around.  Who is the lady that is in danger of having her flat feet on the ground.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mustang Sally

questions.question: Which of these bands released their break through album Pride in 1987, which included the single Wait?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: White Lion

questions.question: Steve Nicks sings She is like a cat in the dark. And then she is the darkness.  Who is the mystical woman who is taken by the wind?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rhiannon

questions.question: A second era in rock music began with the arrival of the Fab Four.  The Beatles would breathe new life into rock  roll and become the most successful and influential band of all time.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Byrds

questions.question: By the early 1960s this new form of music had started to get watered down.  The rawness and rough edges were gone, and rock and roll seemed destined for blandness.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bobby Vinton

questions.question: The 1980s heavy rock band Quiet Riot was founded by guitar player Randy Rhoads.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Who was the lead vocalist for the band Winger, known for the 1988  song Seventeen?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kip Winger

questions.question: Neil Young sings Dreamer of Pictures, I run in the night. You see us together chasing the moonlight.  Who could Neil Young live with for the rest of his life?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cinnamon Girl

questions.question: Who looked like a beauty queen from a movie scene and would dance on the floor, in the round?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Billie Jean

questions.question: In the song On the Cover of Rolling Stone Dr Hook has  teenage blue eyed groupies, an Indian guru, and his dad who drives his limousine. Whats the name of his freaky ole lady who embroiders on his jeans?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cocaine Katy

questions.question: Although she wears a braided chain made of finest silver from the north of Spain this lady works layin whiskey down. Late at night she walks through a silent town because her mans life, love and lady is the sea.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brandy

questions.question: Like Bing Crosby and Frank Sinatra before him, Elvis Presley became the newest heartthrob at the microphone.  This time, however, the teen idol brought a new form of music to the mainstream - rock and roll.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thats All Right (Mama)

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Bands and Eric Clapton
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, zeppelin, reaction. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In the early 1970s, there was a reaction against the over-the-top excesses of psychedelic music.  The singer-songwriter movement was psychedelic musics polar opposite, and often nothing more than a musician and his or her acoustic guitar.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Taylor

questions.question: Heavy metal had its origins with Black Sabbath back in 1970, but it was this bands 1980 heavy metal masterpiece, British Steel, that sent metal on its path to world domination.  By the latter half of the 1980s, bands like Ratt, Def Leppard, and Motley Crue would emerge that were perfectly suited for the excesses that characterized the 80s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Judas Priest

questions.question: Its common knowledge among Eric Clapton fans that his song, Tears in Heaven was written about his son who died from a fall from a window screen.  What was the boys name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Connor

questions.question: Punk rock was largely a reaction against stadium filling bands like Pink Floyd and other so-called pretentious rock acts.  Punk songs were short and raw, and would never dream of containing long guitar solos or complex themed albums like their arena rock enemies.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johnny Rotten

questions.question: In June 2004, Eric Clapton had a fundraiser in Dallas, TX, for his Crossroads Centre in Antigua.  What is the Crossroads Centre?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An alcohol rehabilitation clinic

questions.question: Eric Clapton played the guitar solo on which Beatles song?

options.text: Sgt. Peppers Lonely Hearts Club Band

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: While My Guitar Gently Weeps

questions.question: Eric Clapton was born in Ripley, England on which date?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: March 30, 1945

questions.question: Eric Clapton was in all but which of the following bands?

options.text: He was in all of these bands

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was in all of these bands

questions.question: The 2000s so far (2008) find rock music in a definite downward slope.  Hip Hop and RB dominate the charts, and rock music seems to be unable to produce any bands that can create much of an impact.   Most rock bands are either a hybrid (like rap-metal or pop-punk) or a revival of something old (like garage rock).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The White Stripes

questions.question: J.J. Cale wrote Cocaine, which Eric Clapton made a hit.  Which song, made famous by Lynyrd Skynyrd was also written by J.J. Cale?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They Call Me the Breeze

questions.question: Eric Clapton wrote Wonderful Tonight in a matter of fifteen minutes while doing what?

options.text: Waiting for his son to be born.
Waiting for his wife to get ready.
Waiting for the rest of his band to arrive for a gig.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Waiting for his wife to get ready.

questions.question: In the early 1970s, bands like Led Zeppelin and Grand Funk Railroad initiated a form of rock devised specifically for large concert venues.  By mid-decade, stadium or arena rock was in full swing, and bands with big sounds like Boston and Queen dominated the music scene until the 1980s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Styx

questions.question: By the late 1960s, rock music started to get adventurous.  Even the Monkees were releasing psychedelic music, and The Beatles made the LP into an art form with Revolver and Sgt. Pepper.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pink Floyd

questions.question: By the 1990s, heavy metal was almost unrecognizable from its ancestors.  There simply wasnt much metal left in bands like Poison, Warrant, White Lion and Winger.  So, the time was absolutely right for a new brand of music called grunge to cut through the artificial fluff in much the same way as The Beatles did in 1963 (see questions 2 and 3).  Instead of Liverpool, however, this time the bands would predominantly eminate from which city?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Seattle

questions.question: Punk rock was, by its very nature, destined to self-destruct.  Many punk bands like Blondie began to morph into a friendlier brand of music called New Wave. This shift coincided with a new television channel called MTV that suited their aristic style perfectly.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Adam and the Ants
